intro: Tephroseris praticola, commonly known as the prairie tephroseris, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and small, clustered yellow flowers. This plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as prairies and sandy soils. It is a perennial species that produces seeds through wind dispersal. Tephroseris praticola plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local pollinator populations.
